alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following county, Dale. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 703 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ozark, Ariton, Skipperville, Beamon, Arguta, Dykes Crossroads, Roberts Crossroads, Ward Bridge, Mabson, Phillips Crossroads, Barefield Crossroads, Bells Crossroads, Echo, Snells Crossroads, Bertha and Clopton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
